item.title: Revisiting concurrent data structures
item.description: Introduction Concurrent data structures if implemented carefully can lead to a huge increases in performance. In this post, we’ll try to show that with fancy plots! We will implement and run benchmarks on different lock-based algorithms.

item.title: A novice introduction to Ethereum (Part 1 / 2)
item.description: If you are new to Ethereum and want to quickly understand what’s going on, you’re on the right track. This post is exclusively made for you ! By the end of Part 1, you’ll be able to understand the key concepts of Ethereum!

item.title: A novice introduction to Ethereum (Part 2 / 2)
item.description: In this post, we’ll get our hands dirty. We’ll code our own smart contract, compile it, deploy it on the Ethereum blockchain test network, and play with it !

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there. Iâ€™m Moez, online handle k3nz0, and this is a blog where I post just about magic (i.e code & technology). I like algorithms, computer science and computer security, so I’ll probably post about these topics.

item.title: SnakeSFML
item.description: SnakeSFML is a Snake game developed in C++ and is available in 3 modes (Easy - Medium - Hard). SnakeSFML uses SFML which is a simple, fast, and cross-platform multimedia API provinding access to windowing, graphics, audio and network.

item.title: Pixel-ART
item.description: Pixel-ART simply lets you pixel art your face and optionally add random fancy eyes on it. The technique used is pretty simple; We colorized each grid of (N, N) pixels with the same color.
